Reviews.Title: Priced to please
Reviews.Author: T. Campbell "campscamp222"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this TV at Walmart for $548.  It is our first HDTV.  We looked at a lot of them in various stores.  I did a considerable amount of research and we finally decided on this one. Thought about a 120HZ model but didn't want to spend the extra money.  It fits our budget and we are very satisfied with the quality and functionality. Don't have a blu-ray player yet but have watched standard DVDs with component video connection and picture quality is very very good. Streamed a Netflix movie or two in from our PC via HDMI cable and have viewed a considerable amount of satellite and over-the-air programming for the last month or so. Both standard def and HD picture quality, very nice.  The volume leveling function is not perfect but it does help quite a bit. Sound with built-in speakers is good. Menus are user friendly and easy to navigate. Overall we are very pleased and would recommend this product to others.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: James L. Zhang "Gadfly"
Reviews.Content: Yes, that old saying is very true.  Little after a year of buying the TV, it stopped working.  Contacting Vizio was no help at all for "after warranty support".  I received one generic message telling me that they could not do anything to help, and I should contact one of the "authorized repair vendors".  It would cost $120 just to get some one to come and check the TV.  If they need to replace parts, it could cost hundreds more.This is my 5th flat screen TV.  My oldest Philips plasma TV is still working after close to 8 years.  My mother-in-law bought a Vizio plasma TV about 3 years ago, it just died recently too.  They must have really poor quality assurance.If you HAVE to purchase this TV, you should buy extended warranty, maybe from a local store.  Personally, I would stay away from all Vizio products in the future.Update:In response of last comment, I decided to make an update.  I took some time to take apart the entire TV.  One of the board had a shorted out IC.  It was a board made by LG.  Searching the internet showed that there were none in stock at any of the replacement parts vendors.  I also found out that it was a common problem with this TV.  Without boring every one with technical details, it basically boils down to the power supply exceed the threshold of certain parts, causing they to overheat and burn out.  The problem is so wide spread, that the supplier of the parts could up keep up.  The price range from $150 to $200 for the board.  If you pay some one to do it, the cost would be another $100 to $200 more.At this point, I am just going to drop off the bundle of parts at local Costco warehouse for recycling.  The internal parts were mostly made by LG, some were made by Toshiba and other vendors.  Vizio is a relatively new company.  So this type of integration issue is expected.

Reviews.Title: Love my new tv
Reviews.Author: Debby Miller
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV after hours of reseaching the different brands of Flat Screen LCD (and plasma) TV's.  I chose this one based on the excellent reviews that the professional reviewers gave it.  Their main comment was that it was a good value for the price.  It has a lot of options that you would expect on higher end TV's.  It was very easy to hook up too.  I'm a 5 foot lady whose husband was out of town when it was delivered.  It wasn't too hard or heavy for me to unpack and hook up.  Another good thing is that I have not had to use the instruction book at all yet.  The buttons on the remote are easy to understand when trying to access different features of the TV.One thing that seems small, but is something I really like is that when you hit the 'on' button, the Vizio logo changes from white to orange so you know the TV received the signal. It only takes a couple seconds for the screen to display, but you could actually turn it back off thinking you didn't hit the button right without that signal.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Kevin Mazzone
Reviews.Content: I picked up this TV the other night from Sam's Club. With their Labor Day sale, I got it for $498. What a deal!Hook up was a breeze. It has component inputs that I could use to hook up my HD DirecTV receiver to, a Playstation 2 to the composite input, and soon a Blu-Ray player to one of the HDMI jacks.So far the picture quality is great for HD and SD programming. The blacks are deep and the other colors are vibrant. I bought this expecting the picture to be like a budget TV, but was pleasantly surprised at how nice it looks. I didn't expect it to even come close to my $1500 Samsung (52" @ Costco).Finally I really don't notice the 120hz difference. My Samsung is 120 and I've turned it off since it gives me a headache, but I don't see any difference in picture quality.Hope this review helps...

Reviews.Title: Satisfied... for now!
Reviews.Author: Four Gee Sixty Three
Reviews.Content: I actually was saving up for a Sharp Aquos 55" LED Edgelit 1080P HDTV from here on amazon, but just busted on a random trip to walmart. I decided to just go for this TV and spend the extra money on a new PS3 Slim, and a couple blu-ray movies. This HDTV does not have the newer tech, like advanced refresh rates (60/120/240 hrz) or LED lighting versus flourescent bulb lighting in this one, but it DOES have what is considered by most now to be the standard for HDTV viewing, and that is 1)1080P full high-def resoultion, and 2) at least 42" in viewable size. Blu-Ray disc playback via Playstation 3 worked fine, but I have seen better 1080p images on slightly more expensive sets. This TV does a DECENT DVD-upscaling job via the Playstation 3, but again, I have seen better and can notice the difference right away. My buddy's 47" Samsung 1080p 120hz does a much more noticeable job of DVD upscaling, proving its the TV that does the job, not the component (in this case, Playstation 3). All in all, for the average user, these quibbles will not make too much of a difference, as I am leaning toward the videophile side, so my eye is already trained to spot these differences. Don't let this dissuade you, this is a great HDTV for the money and will satisfy most people looking for a decently-priced ticket into the HD world.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV!
Reviews.Author: ConTeacher
Reviews.Content: We got this TV a little over a month ago and are very happy with it.  The TV is in a bright room (one wall is all windows) and the ambient light sensor work great; keeping the image viewable regardless of light levels in the room.  There is virtually no reflection from the screen, even with the windows open.  The sound is OK, considering the small built-in speakers.  The high-gloss plastic shows the kids finger prints, but that's just an annoyance.We use the HDMI-1 input for our media player and the NTSC connection for Cable TV.  Both work great.

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING HDTV FOR THE $$$
Reviews.Author: Marshawn2
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv brand new for $538 at Sam's Club ( + membership in good-standing).  It has a beautiful, clean, clear picture, rich colors, easy to understand menu options.  It was out of the box and set up in less than 10 minutes. It is light weight, & can be hung from the wall like a picture with the proper tv mounting apparatus.  It is an excellent choice for WATCHING tv which, is what I bought it for. It has good, clear internal speakers but, they do not produce that "movie-theater sound".  It does have the ports needed for hooking up an additional sound system, dvd, etc., if desired.Being technologically challenged as I am, I do not completely understand all the specs on this tv. I do understand that this a fairly basic HDTV and it's great for just sitting & watching, no gaming, no internet, no tricks. It does have a USB port but, from what I understand, that is only for viewing photographs straight from a digital camera.For my basic requirements, this has been the perfect tv.

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price
Reviews.Author: Victor M Lopez
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV on October 8 and had it delivered October 25.  Would have had it sooner if not for some out of stock snafu that must have occurred at the warehouse.TV was delivered by their shipping company (Pilot) in perfect condition and literally took me less than 10 minutes to unbox and turn on with everything connected.  Picture is excellent and the TV itself looks good.  This is my 3rd Vizio TV in the house (others are smaller ones in the bedroom) and I would definitely buy them again.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Scoffin
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a 42inch Vizio. The Picture is fantastic and the only minor complaint is that i wish it had one more HDMI port (Only has 2). Other then that this is a quality TV that works great with the XBOX 360 as well as DVDs

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: I recieved this TV and the picture quality is great.  I've always heard Vizio was a good brand, so I purchased it and I don't regret it.  The delivery was fast I didn't wait long at all.  Great purchase all in all =]

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Price
Reviews.Author: D. Weidig "Doug W"
Reviews.Content: I have been using Vizio HDTVs since I bought my first HDTV. The quality you get at the price they charge is a steal. While it is slightly disappointing that this model only has 2 HDMI ports, its a minor gripe on my end since I plug most of HDMI stuff into my surround sound receiver and using just the one port on the TV. But I am very happy with my purchase and it came to my house very quickly since it shipped out of Ft Worth TX and I live in central TX, so standard shipping only took 3 days. I've heard the complaints about Vizio's products, but considering my old Vizio that this TV replaces is still working like a champ either I'm very lucky or the complaints are unwarranted. Great TV!!!!

Reviews.Title: Been 3 weeks (used purchase)
Reviews.Author: Jesse Pinder "J Colten"
Reviews.Content: Picture is amazing.  My little emachines computer looks brilliant on this screen.  Changing from computer to Timewarner (gag) or PS3 is easy.  This was made for people not technically inclined like myself.  The logo does stay on below the screen when plugged in (as someone else stated), but this is not something big enough to bother me.  The sound....could be better but what tv really has great sound anyway.  That's why we get surround sound RIGHT??Anyway, this is for my bedroom and I feel like I've spoiled myself.  The only thing odd is volume jumping (highs and lows).  This is only a problem if you are trying to keep the noise down for other people in the house.  If you can turn it up you won't be bothered with it.  But if the volume is low you might miss part of the dialogue in a movie.  This could be the programming though... just not sure.  If you are setting up surround sound anyway and want a big LCD for little money and excellent picture then you won't be disappointed.Oh strange thing, (this could be that I bought this used from amazon market) there were screws missing for the foot of the LCD (what is stands on).  I was about to flip out but when the foot attached and I heard a suction type noise I realized this won't come off that easily anyway.  So my foot is just pushed in and hasn't come off, even after moving to a new house.

Reviews.Title: Unstated Guarantee -- It will die in a short period of time
Reviews.Author: Richard E. Rockwell "Flashscamp"
Reviews.Content: I was more fortunate than most.  My Vizio 42" lasted three years two months.  Or two month after my 3 year extended warranty ended.  I contacted Vizio and was told that out of warranty units had to be repaired by their authorized repair representatives.  I asked for their Massachusetts representatives telephone numbers.I was only given one--HD Repair.  Vizio assured me that HDR could take care of me.I called HDR and was told that they would diagnose my TV over the phone and send me a quote for parts needed.  Once I paid for it they would order parts and send a repair man to install.  All I needed was to give them my model and serial number.  I told them I couldn't get that info immediately.  I would call them back with the info.I then searched them out on Google and found that they are a Florida based company and they contracted repairmen in every state to do the on site installation.I don't know about you, but I certainly do not trust anyone that claims they can diagnose a problem over the telephone.So do not buy Vizio.  If you do, big problems are in your future.rirockw

Reviews.Title: Great video, poor audio
Reviews.Author: StarProf
Reviews.Content: Our son gave us this TV for Christmas, purchased locally. We are very satisfied with the picture, especially compared to our 5 year old Samsung machine. The remote control is a bit small, but we have a Logitech universal control which works with the Vizio.  The sound quality is reedy, very thin. We have the audio running out to our receiver/amplifier and external speakers. We use the TV speakers at about level 16 (as a "center channel") and the good sound comes out of our big old speakers. Only problem is having to push two remote control mute buttons to make it quiet.  I don't know how much our son paid for the Vizio, but it seems to be a good value. He also bought an extended warranty on it. He commented that the picture looked as good as his 120 Hz Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Solid HDTV
Reviews.Author: James D. Sheetz "jdsheetz"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this TV for several months now and it is a solid performer.  Picture quality is excellent and it does exactly what it is supposed to do.  I gave it four stars instead of five simply because I have to compare it to 120 Hz LED backlit models and they do have a better picture.  But, for the price this on is impossible to beat.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for PS3
Reviews.Author: S. Lee "saint168"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV for my kids to play PS3 games so I don't need all the extra features like internet connectivity and PIP.  This TV has a feature that the kids love.  No matter what input the TV was on before it was turned off, when they turn on the PS3 which is connected through HDMI, the TV will turn itself on AND set the input to the HDMI port that the PS3 is connected to.  So one press on the PS3 button on the controller is all it takes.  As far as picture and sound quality, it is comparable to my 47" LG LED LCD TV which cost more than double.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E420VO Best TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: KL14
Reviews.Content: I was shopping for a new bedroom TV and was ready to pay much more at discount store prices.  I found this 42" Vizio on Amazon with free shipping.  My friends told me I would find a mangled box in the rain at my front door.  Actually, their delivery company setup an appointment, brought it into my house and had me inspect it before signing off on the item.  I have a 56" Samsung and a 32" Philips.  The picture on the Vizio is as good as or better than either one.

Reviews.Title: Vizio is ok
Reviews.Author: Vince Borner
Reviews.Content: So far, so good. I have heard a lot of good and bad things about this unit, but from my view it seems ok. I will comment after 6 months with it. But for the most part deliver, setup and response I like the purchase.The TV is dead in the water right after the warranty expired there are two lines in the screen and I don't know if that can be fixed.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: G. Jentz
Reviews.Content: Quick, responsive delivery and easy setup! Picture and sound are great! This is the second Vizio, this model, I have purchased and each is a great buy! Got it for my wife and she just loves it!

Reviews.Title: Its a good product
Reviews.Author: vijji "vijji"
Reviews.Content: Its a good product for the price. I have this for the past 1 month and felt no complaints except one.When using remote, we need to point it straight towards tv otherwise, it won't work. That's a minor thing, though. Otherwise, there are no issues with this model.

Reviews.Title: Early take on the 42" LCD Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: countryguyinny
Reviews.Content: Well, after just a couple of days, here's my take on the 42 inch Vizio LCD TV.  Setup was a breeze, very easy and had the TV working in just a few minutes.The picture was not very bright at first, but after making several adjustments under picture settings, the picture brightened up considerably.  I do not see any difference however in the brightness with the windows wide open, I still have to shut them at least partially in order to see the picture well.  I have this feature set on high, maybe that is the wrong setting?The picture is very clear and I have no complaints about it once the brightness got OK.  It seems like the movies from Netflix (using an internet-connected LG Blue ray player) are really really good quality, as are videos, movies from other internet channels (I got rid of DirecTV).The sound -- here's the bad part.  The sound from the TV speakers is horrible.  I am not an audiophile, but it really is pretty amazingly bad...very thin, tinny, sounds like it is coming out of a tin can.  I made several adjustments under Audio settings, but none of them could make it sound much better.  However, I am using the same (very very cheap) surround system I used with my previous (oldstyle) TV, and the sound from that is awesome...even better than it was before.  I attribute this, however to the LG player, not the TV.I am satisfied so far, but certainly would not recommend this TV to someone who does not have external speakers.  Perhaps more to come later...UPDATE:  I have now had this TV for 17 months.  Narrow, vertical, purple lines are showing up on the screen, there are three so far and they keep getting darker.  I have contacted Vizio, but don't expect any help, since my warranty expired 5 months ago.  As stated by others, do NOT buy this TV without the extended warranty!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice television
Reviews.Author: KGB
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set in time for the college football season and have been pleased with the performance. It replaced a 36" tube monstrosity that weighed more than 200 pounds. This set was easy to set up, gives a very nice HD picture and a better than average non-HD pic.Can't say yet how durable it will be but so far, so good.

Reviews.Title: BUYERS BEWARE:  DO NO BUY A VIZIO!!!
Reviews.Author: Khoi Dang
Reviews.Content: BUYERS BEWARE:  DO NO BUY A VIZIO!!!  Vizio TV's are cheap, and they appear to give you the biggest bang for your buck, but they simply to no work as promised.  I purchased a Vizio XVT553SV which, at the time, was their flagship model.  Immediately, it had video artifacts/flickering on every input (Dish, PS3, media player).  Vizio's website even admits to this and promises that a firmware update and clean storage procedure would fix this!!! Vizio updated the firmware, and the issue appeared to be resolved for a few weeks, but then returned.  Vizio customer support had me do a power recycle, which resolved the issue for a few weeks, but, again the issues returned and new ones appeared - the video would freeze upon a cold start-up, the TV would turn off automatically in the middle of watching TV for no reason whatsoever. Vizio technical support had me do clean storage procedure which appeared to resolve the issue for a few days, but then the issues again returned.  Technical support  also admitted that the issue of the TV turning off intermittently will still be an issue until Vizio updates the firmware and they are looking into this issue now.  Through these issues, we could still watch TV - the issues were merely a nagging nuisance.  Finally fed up and fearful that the TV would fail once out of the warranty period, I called Vizio and they sent out a Technician to replace the logic board.  Within an hour after the technician left, the TV failed altogether.  Vizio now wants to replace my new TV that was defective upon arrival with a recertified TV which I objected to.  In order to get a new TV, they want me to pay an extra $300.00 plus tax!  I asked "Ashley" of Vizio customer support how she would feel paying good money for a "new" TV, but instead, getting a recertified TV.  She said she would be upset but this is their corporate policy.  So, buy a Vizio at your own risk - because it is very risky to do so.  Incredible that Vizio would put out a product knowing that it had existing defects and then screwing customers over!!.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: nicole
Reviews.Content: love it!! images are crystal clear, remote is easy to use... it's a great TV for a great price!

Reviews.Title: E420VO - do not buy, died shortly after warranty expired
Reviews.Author: John A. Brooker
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV was very good and the sound was OK, but the TV died shortly after the warranty expired.  You would turn the TV on,the Vizio name would appear on the screen, and then it would shut off w/in a few seconds.  I tried aunplugging, letting it sit for days/weeks, and tried it again w/ the same results.  I've seen this referred to as the "black screen of death" and is a common problem with this model and other Vizio models.  Do an internet search about this problem and Vizio TVs and you will see how widespread the problem is.  I'm not sure what brand I will buy next but I will never buy another Vizio product again.  Maybe it will be a Samsung since my 56", 8-yr old Samsung 1080p DLP has many more hours on it and still works great.

Reviews.Title: Flaw In TV after 2.5 Years
Reviews.Author: Kristen Hoschouer
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for only 2.5 years and now there's a green line in the right hand corner.  I'm not sure how it got there, but I'm not happy about it. I should have gone with a more expensive, higher quality TV. I wouldn't recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Totally Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Spine
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this TV to anyone looking to buy one. The picture quality is nice and sharp, colors are true to life and the sound is nice and clear with plenty of features.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: L. Speer "Eliza"
Reviews.Content: I bought this when I had to return my 42 in. RCA bc it blew up shortly after I bought it. This was best bang for the buck. I have had it for two years and is still going strong!

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: W. R. Chouinard "Bill"
Reviews.Content: THIS HAS BEEN A GREAT TV . SO MUCH SO THAT I DIDN'T HESITATE TO BUY A 60" VIZIO.NO COMPLAINTS.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: John Sellers
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother. She loves it and it was half the price of a similar LG 42" I bought only three years before. It isn't the latest nor greatest but if all you are looking for is a 60Hz 1080p TV that has a good picture, this will work great. From what I remember of playing with it, the sound was pretty good but I view it a crime to NOT use a dedicated sound system with a HD TV.

Reviews.Title: Poor QA, take your money then say no help
Reviews.Author: Ralph  West
Reviews.Content: After Vizio confirmed, Tv ship from manufactor to store & purhased by me in the same month, Asked for money for warranty, when problems started, they can't help with out lost recipt.I now own a different brand and will be giving $900 worth of BAD publicity to anyone who will lesson.They need to repair the QA department personnel.Ralph West

Reviews.Title: great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Julie Breecham
Reviews.Content: I bought a refurb for our bedroom.  So far sound and picture qualify have ecxeeded my expectations.  People have complained about the volume not being loud enough, but it has been perfect for this room.  Granted, the room is small so I couldn't attest for anything else.  This is my first VIZIO and so far I love it!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful tv!
Reviews.Author: laura theiss
Reviews.Content: Such an amazing tv. Truly amazing  picture, perfect sound. I don't want to leave my living room. I am so happy we got this tv and it's a great price. You won't regret getting it!

Reviews.Title: Disposable T.V. Spend 100 more and get a different brand please!
Reviews.Author: William1205
Reviews.Content: I had my 42 inch for a year or two and it pooped out the other day. It does happen to a lot of vizio so I would recommend any other brand tv!

Reviews.Title: Still love it
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: It looks nice and clean, works well, and it's big. The sound goes out a little bit from time to time but it's well worth what I paid.

Reviews.Title: 1 year later. Still a good TV.
Reviews.Author: John Truitt
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV during one of the lightning sales last Christmas. I got it for incredibly cheap. I was a little wary of Vizio because I had heard there are some problems with some of their E-brand TVs. After having this TV for a year I have to say it's great. I may be one of the lucky ones who got a well built one, or maybe I'm just more careful than some, but my TV is still in great working order. The picture is fantastic, the sound is good, and the screen has almost no glare. My only issue with this TV is it's a little heavy, but compared to a tube TV it's still not that bad. Overall a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 42 in tv
Reviews.Author: Terri Jakupco "dog lover"
Reviews.Content: Great TV for family room.  Sharp bright pictures. Second Vizio we own and happy with both of them.  Reasonable pricing makes a larger TV affordable.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: BAL
Reviews.Content: First time ordering a TV online.  Arrived earlier than expected, and in perfect condition.Sound could be better, but maybe if we added external speakers that would improve.  Would buy this item again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome deal!
Reviews.Author: Kayla
Reviews.Content: Was a little nervous to buy something used online.. but we took a chance and were pleasantly surprised! The TV arrived in excellent condition, the picture and sound quality are great, and in stores you will pay double for something just as good.. I would definately reccomend this to other people!

Reviews.Title: seeing is believing
Reviews.Author: elrucco
Reviews.Content: i am so pleased with my vizio i can't find additional words to complement it.  the quality,the picture and the sound are second to none. i say this because i want other people to enjoy.  para el precio que paque, yo me lo robe.  don't try asking me back for it. thanks.

Reviews.Title: Own 2 and Love Them Both!
Reviews.Author: RVR2
Reviews.Content: I own 2 of these for my 2 bedrooms and the picture quality is just fantastic! I have both mounted on my walls (I used a Sanus VM400b full motion heavy duty wall mount) for better viewing and to utilize my shelf space for my electronics and DVDs. I also use them as monitors for my computers.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 42lcd tv
Reviews.Author: BARRY GAUNT
Reviews.Content: GREAT TV.  I WAS A LITTLE LEARY ABOUT A REFURBED TV BUT AS SOON AS I OPENED THE BOX, I WAS PLEASANTLY SURPRISED.  I HAVE BEEN USING IT NOW FOR ABOUT A MONTH, AND IT HAS BEEN GREAT.  NO DEAD PIXELS, GOOD VOLUME CONTROL, GREAT PICTURE.  MY FRIENDS, FAMILY, LOVE IT THE PLAYSTATION WORKS GREAT AND THE HDMI IS WONDERFUL.  THANKS FOR AN EASY, FAST, EFFICIENT TRANSACTION.  I LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Could not be more pleased.
Reviews.Author: Henry Lamb (hlamb88937@aol.com) "Affinity"
Reviews.Content: You will never see or tell the difference between this TV and the most expensive.We had purchased a 47" Vizio two years ago. Could not be more satisfied. Played a game at the store. We covered up the prices and the names of all the brands  and then picked the best picture. I chose to Vizio. I would have thought it would have been the Sony.  Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: Great price and great quality
Reviews.Author: Faith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv as our main tv for the living room.  I rarely get to watch it, since my kids love to play the Wii on it.  They love having a larger screen to play their games on.  I have had it over a month and love it.  No problems with it, great picture and sound.  I am not a super picky person and I have this in my apartment.  It fits my needs and expectations.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: this was one of the most easiest set up user friendly TV I have ever bought  clear picture sound is fantastic and nice case too cleans well.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: mmm
Reviews.Content: This is my second Vizio tv.  I have a 32" in the bedroom.  I am so happy with it that purchasing a second  Vizio for the den was an easy decision. The set-up is super easy and the picture is great.  Thank you Vizio for making a great product at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Great Value
Reviews.Author: Jeff Gortney
Reviews.Content: I have been looking at HD TVs for a while now just waiting for the time that I could purchase my first.  I have done some research on TVs and everywhere I looked everyone rated Vizio TVs very highly.  After having this TV for a month now, and with HD content from my cable provider I can agree.  You cannot buy a better TV for the money.  The only thing I was a little uneasy about was ordering a TV online, but as usual Amazon made the complete process easy.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E420VO review.
Reviews.Author: Nikolay Georgieff
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about 4 weeks. It has everything I want in a LCD TV. The picture is very clear and the sound is good. It was easy to set up. I am very satisfied with my purchase. I would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Value at a great price!!
Reviews.Author: j-boogie
Reviews.Content: I've had my vizio for more than a month now and I couldn't be happier with it. I spent a long time looking at all of the options before deciding and I believe I made the right choice. I've watched dvd's and played video games and so far so good. It truly is an outstanding value at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value for the $$$$$$
Reviews.Author: david t ryan
Reviews.Content: We searched for a value priced 40" plus TV to replace our 27" tube TV for almost a month.  We were looking for a highly rated TV with a good picture quality.  My son (who wasn't aware that i made this purchase) sold HDTV's at a big box store and when the Vizio arrived he was amazed that for the price ($488) it had 100,000 to 1 color contrast.  The color sharpness is pretty amazing.  After watching 6 NFL playoff games, 1/2 dozen Blu rays, and regular satellite HD TV the picture at 60 Mhz delivers an amazing experience.  Watching snow fall during the Bears Packers game was pretty nice - we thought we were front row upper deck!  We only have had the TV for 3 weeks so we can't comment on the longevity but so far - great TV!  The TV's sound quality is also really good - but we upgraded to a surround sound to complement the TV's overall experience.My only advise is to consider a faster shipping method than standard.  The TV arrived 12 days after purchase through Home Direct.  The delivery people were friendly and courteous but the TV shipped from Arizona - almost the other coast away - and we missed a weekend of football.  So, if you want it faster - upgrade the shipping method or I should have used my son's Amazon Prime account for possibly a faster deliveryVery satisfied for now and will update if anything happens along the way.

Reviews.Title: BIG Step Up for just a bit more
Reviews.Author: apayne82
Reviews.Content: Originally bought the TCL 40" HDTV now priced at $399 (I paid $429).  It was a stinker - poor picture and overall quality.  Returned it easily with Amazon's great return policy, and ordered this Vizio 42".  For an extra $50, I got a great picture and an extra 2" to boot.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: perfect budget TV
Reviews.Author: Ryan Rupracht
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about 3 months and have watched over a dozen netflix movies, football games, and played some playstation on it and so far its been great.  I do not have pay to view TV service, and the picture is great still with an antenna.  I bought a dolby 5.1 surround sound and DVD player to go with it all together with a 2 yr warrenty less than $800 invested.(even the tv speakers are descent)  I couldn't be happier.  If you want a TV with a nice picture and don't care about all the little petty (don't really make a viewing difference) things that drive the price up on a more expensive brand than this is the TV for you.  I cannot attest to its long term durablity yet but you could buy a $2000 TV and it could die a day later.

Reviews.Title: Vizio Rocks
Reviews.Author: Vizio's newest customer
Reviews.Content: I received my t.v. in three days!!! Great job Amazon.  I must say I have seen this brand of t.v. in Wal-Mart on several occasions.  When I saw the t.v. on Amazon the price was great, so I decided to give it a try.  I am very glad I did.  The picture quality and the sound are fantastic.  I will be purchasing another t.v. for one of my bedrooms soon and you best  believe Amazon will be the place and Vizio will be the t.v.  Thanks for the wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: Washed out colors, poor sharpness.
Reviews.Author: GRC
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend the E421VO. Here's why:I already had a Vizio VX37L at home. I also have an old Hitachi CRT TV that's rated 720i resolution (a very uncommon thing for a CRT TV.) I began by buying a Vizio E3D420VX. I set it side-by-side with each existing TV one at a time. I fed the same signal into both the E3D420VX and one of the old ones simultaneously. I compared the two TVs with standard definition 480i digital (from my satellite box), with 480p from an antenna, and then with 1080i from the antenna. (I don't yet have HD service from my satellite provider.)With all three signal types, the old TVs were each noticeably better than the E3D420VX. The E3D420VX was not as bright, even with the backlight and the brightness turned up to 100%. The colors were not as vivid and not as true as on either of the older sets, regardless of how much I adjusted the color settings. With the 480 signals, the E3D420VX showed a lot of pixellation around the edges of everything in the picture. Even with the 1080i signal, there was a little more pixellation than with the old TVs running at 480i. Finally, the sharpness was noticeably worse on the E3D420VX.I next tried a Vizio E421VO. With the same tests, the results were nearly the same; both the old TVs out-performed the E421VO.I decided to try one more time. So I bought a Vizio M420VT. It's a keeper! The picture is bright, the colors are true, and the 1080i is sharp with no pixellation. With the 480 signals, there is still some pixellation, but it's acceptable if I sit back at least ten feet. So it's time to upgrade my satellite service to HD.

Reviews.Title: Fairly Good Buy
Reviews.Author: raggazadilotta
Reviews.Content: We have had this tv for 5 months and it already has a few quirks. The tv continually turns off and reboots on us, which is frustrating during your favorite tv shows when you don't have a DVR. Additionally, the on/off button often doesn't work unless you push it with purpose. Sometimes it takes a few tries to get it which is annoying. However, the picture is fantastic as is the sound. It is a beautifully designed tv and is great for internet use, computer/video hook-ups, etc.

Reviews.Title: A good extra room TV
Reviews.Author: Todd Priebe
Reviews.Content: This is a good second TV or for the kids, not the quality of picture for my living room. But what can you expect from  a $500 television.  I am very happy with it, we got it for our bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Christmas in HD
Reviews.Author: SB Skipper
Reviews.Content: After searching for the perfect flat screen Amazon delivered. Best price I'd seen after all my reviewing of the web. No tax, free shipping, etc. That's not all. I ordered a couple of weeks before Christmas and got confirmation that it would arrive with a few days to spare. The following Wednesday (three days early!) I got a call to CHOOSE the time for my delivery. Two very nice gentlemen Delivered it and removed the packaging. They then set it up on my console and plugged it in. I was amazed at that type of service. All I had to do was plug in my HDMI and cable. Within minutes I was enjoying my flat screen and surround sound. The quality of the Vizio needs no explanation. But, I was blown away with the timely, courteous service and the best price ever. Thanks for a GREAT Christmas!

Reviews.Title: repeat purchase for gift
Reviews.Author: M. D.
Reviews.Content: Read reviews on Vizeo before the first purchase three years ago and they have proved true in every way on the set I  bought for myself.This Christmas we decided to splurge a little for our two daughters and their family and a wide screen led seemed a good choice.With three years experience with a Vizeo we did not consider another brand, and with several years shopping experience with Amazon we really didn't consider another retailer.I can't say you will have as good an experience as I've had with both product and dealer but when I move up to a larger set you can be sure Amazon and Vizeo will be my choice.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: This is our second LCD tv.  The first one is a Samsung we received as a gift two years ago for our family room and we really really love that TV.  We got this Vizio for our bedroom and I think that the picture on this Vizio is just as good as the Samsung.  We have found that with full screen DVD movies you have to change the screen format to wide everytime, which is a bit annoying but not a deal breaker.  Did not experience the phantom buzzing that some people have complained about.  The delivery service was fantastic, made it a valuable reason to purchase from Amazon as opposed to going down to Walmart or Costco as my car is not big enough to haul one of these babies anyway.  We paid $488 for this TV!A month prior to purchasing this Vizio we picked up a 37" Vizio from Target for $400 + $31 tax.  We were not thrilled with the picture quality, widescreen movies made people appear shorter and fatter than usual.  When we found this deal it was a no brainer to spend the extra $50 to get a bigger and better TV.  Couldn't be happier with the swap.  Since this TV is for our bedroom we were especially happy that the Vizio insignia on the front lights up orange when powered off, as the 37" Vizio from Target would light up white, bright and made it very annoying when powered off and trying to sleep.So far so good on this model, I hope this TV lasts us a good long while as we really really like it.  Thanks again Amazon!

Reviews.Title: seems great
Reviews.Author: Encourage thinking "xena"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this from Amazon yesterday, received it today (great service from Amazon as usual), had it hooked up in no time.  I don't have it hooked up to HD yet, but the picture right now is great.  So far we're thrilled.  I'll update later if that changes.  Setting it up was easy.  The only problem is if you have comcast there aren't any remote codes for Vizio tvs.  I found some suggestions on a forum and for those with Comcast the remote code for the remote with the grey "ok" button is 0178.

Reviews.Title: My Vizio Tv
Reviews.Author: yoder69
Reviews.Content: The tv is great.  The only thing that was not good was the shipping.  It took way to long.  The people that brought the tv were very nice and very good.

Reviews.Title: OK TV, Slight Buzz Sound?
Reviews.Author: Charles R Garner
Reviews.Content: The TV was fine,  just as expected, replaced an old 32" clunker.  The delivery from Home Direct took longer than expected but still within what was quoted while ordering.I am getting a very slight buzz sound when only the TV is on- not coming from the speakers-  I suspect it's backlight related.  I made sure to register the TV in case it dies or gets louder.I think for the price, I'm happy.  No buyer's remorse here.

Reviews.Title: If you can pay more, do so
Reviews.Author: Sb
Reviews.Content: This t.v has an awful picture quality if it's not in HD, also it will cut out part of the images shown on the television, I tried to adjust several times but failed....so if you don't have much money, don't really care about the picture quality on regular channels, and it's okay that you may see partial images then this is the t.v for you

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: cory
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv at walmart in 2009 for an on sale price for then of $598+ tax. It hasn't given any grief yet since it is out of manufactures warranty. But it is hard to find the right picture set up for playing games on it, since the picture can be either to dark or to bright on game setting. There is no hdmi for hdmi capable audio reveivers. Now i can't wait to purchase a newer bigger one with wifi ready.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Huge Screen, Great Sound
Reviews.Author: Defector "keep travelling"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic TV, picture is crisp and BIG! Colors are excellent, the auto ambient adjustment of brightness to the room lighting works well. Deep rich blacks with lots of shadow detail and also lots of detail in highlights.I also use this TV for PS3 Gaming and the hdmi output for the PS3 is stunning as is the sound quality.My only issue with it is that I am constantly changing the mode setting from Standard, Wide, Stretch etc to make the pictures fill the screen, not a fault of Vizio but the TV programming being inconsistent from one show to the next.The real issue is with AT&T; U-Verse... When the TV is in say Wide or stretch mode the guide menus are loat off the edges of the TV screen so when you want to view the guide you have to change the viewing mode back to standard. A bit of a pain for sure.Overall I give this TV a 9/10.And who can grumble at $488 for a 42 inch TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Lady Cyn Aptic
Reviews.Content: I keep updating this review at around the year mark... I've had this TV now for over 2 years and have had no issues... I am tempted to upgrade to a 60" 3D TV, but that does not say anything about the quality of this product.  It is working just as well as it was when I bought it, no problems whatsoever.  It mounts on the wall easily with the proper hardware, and there is generally enough room to to change out the hook ups in back if you have smaller hands like me without messing with the mount.  Picture is great, sound is great... buy with confidence.

Reviews.Title: Love the Vizio!
Reviews.Author: tj
Reviews.Content: Love the no glare screen!  Set it up myself - didn't believe that was possible.  Very happy with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Xannfir
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how great of a deal this TV was.  I can now play video games while sitting on the couch, not having to sit closer to snipe people or read through menus.  The picture looks really great and has everything I need.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Michelle Molina "happy homemaker"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV on Black Friday to replace the old tube TV we had in our livingroom. The sound and picture quality is excellent and we haven't had any problems at all. It was very easy to set up and is very easy to use. This is the second Vizio TV we have purchased and have not been disappointed at all by the company.

Reviews.Title: Love Vizio! SWEET
Reviews.Author: Deborah Anderson
Reviews.Content: We own a Vizio 55" Lcd and love it! Wanted to get my husbands parents a new tv since theirs was the old type and they were having trouble with "darkness". Thought a LCD would be alot brighter for them and since we own a Vizio we wanted that brand. Got it at a good price so we got this for them...also ended up purchasing another for my sister...so far ...GREAT!

Reviews.Title: Vizio - has great value models
Reviews.Author: Chris Fuller "chf_2258"
Reviews.Content: I am not a gamer and watch HD channels on occasion. The only device I connect this TV (Wal-Mart $548) to, besides the cable box, is a DVD player. And high-end audio is not a big priority for me. For my requirements and budget this is a great TV. At the most, I sit 10-12 ft away and my lady is about 6-8ft away and we love it. The only question I have about LCD's/large screen TV's in general is why the standard picture view does not fill the screen? Why do we have to choose "zoom" or "panoramic" etc....?This is my second Vizio (we have a value 32" model in the bedroom) and I am pleased with both purchases.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't get better
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: This television couldn't get any better. It was $488.00 with no other costs and it shipped very quickly. The quality is excellent. I would recommend this to anybody who wants to game or watch sports on it. I highly suggest the HDMI cable that amazon sells for your inputs. The only problem I encountered is that they gave me the wrong size screw to put the tv on the stand but I found one to fit it.

Reviews.Title: worth the wait!
Reviews.Author: ciccars
Reviews.Content: Waited in vain for my 32" Toshiba to die, but couldn't wait any longer. Gave it away to a friend, and hopped on the offer for this 42" Vizio. I studied this for a year, looked at and compared the models in many stores, and when the price dipped below $500, I decided the time had come. Delivered in less than 4 days, the setup was a breeze, and the picture and sound are better than expected--rivals any picture found in the stores.  The 60hz works great--no noticeable blurs so far, and the 1080p and 100,000 dynamic contrast ratio couldn't be any better. All in all, after a month of viewing, I can say this HDTV was well worth waiting for!

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV - a GREAT purchase!
Reviews.Author: Sherrie R
Reviews.Content: My 42-inch Vizio TV arrived within the promised time frame.  Well-packaged and easily assembled.  Within 30 minutes I was watching CNN on my new TV.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Had to replace my Akia 42
Reviews.Author: P. G. Murray "Wooddust"
Reviews.Content: We needed to replace my Akia 42 plasma tv. It was slowly going bad lines when first turn on. We bought this new Vizio at Walmart on sale for $498. One of my requirements was 1080. and a small budget this time. I paid $1300 on sale four years ago for the Akai plus tax. So that's over $300 a year plus I bought the extended warranty. So that's makes it over $400 a year as you know Circuit City is History. So this time any use over two years I'm way ahead. The picture is very good,except from the side. the sound from the speakers just so, so. But that really does not matter as I use my sound sym. So for around $500 for a 42 inch TV is a good deal. Time will tell as to how it holds up.

Reviews.Title: Shipping was thru the post office.
Reviews.Author: Happychicx
Reviews.Content: While I don't have any complaint on the tv...it is your BASIC 42" LCD and the recipients were happy with it. When I ordered it I thought this will be convenient....a fair price and delivered to the front door for free, sounded perfect during a busy holiday season.  What I didn't realize when I ordered it that the FREE SHIPPING special meant it came through the US Postal service and NO the postman did not bring it to the door, they just left a note to come pick it up at the post office....one of the few places I was trying to avoid while shopping online!  I never imagined a tv that size would ship that way....but I got to stand in the line at the post office for 30 minutes and then have it shoved out to me to load up on my own.  Overall, not quite the "Black Friday" deal I was expecting and a couple of days later I saw it locally for the same price.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Jim Bolden Sr. "Graphyfotoz"
Reviews.Content: Can't understand some of the bad reviews.Like with anything man made nothing is perfect bound to be a bad unit here and there.Well I had the Vizio VX32L LCD 32" since 2008 and never had any troubles.It was time for a jump to a bigger TV with 1080p.Wife got a great Christmas bonus this year so it was time to make the move.Walmart (Open Box) $432.00 tax inc.....how could I pass that up.90 day store return and 1yr Factory.....so I'm covered.The value is there.....couldn't find another 42" with the same features for the price.The only real complaint I have is calibrating the color is a real touchy endeavor!These newer Tv's have several tweaks for color are brightness....takes time.Sharp looking design for the TV(don't look cheapish)and it has plenty of features.I does use much less power than my old one....86watts vs 190watts!!My Blu-Ray comes next week so I'll really be able to test then!**************UPDATE 11/17/2011***************Here it is about a year later.....no problems at all!I have this hooked to my AV Receiver and Wii also patch my laptop to it now and then.BluRay is simply amazing on this TV....the 1080 resolution really is sharp!VISIO is a excellent TV and it's a much over looked brand for quality...it's there.I'd recommend VISIO to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: Vizio E420vo
Reviews.Author: B Hinsberg
Reviews.Content: The sound goes up and down automatically. I have another make of TV that does not do the same. The provider claims it is not them that changes the sound. It is not ads necessarily when the sound changes

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Vizio Flatscreen!!!
Reviews.Author: Lisa G
Reviews.Content: This is our first Vizio and we are impressed with the quality, sound and durability. It has an absolutely lovely picture, we love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Quick service
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: We received our TV within a few days of ordering it. Also we had some questions with set up and running it and support was extremely helpful through it all

Reviews.Title: Vizio 42" 1080p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Patrick Foy
Reviews.Content: TV came in orginal box and was well worth the 430.00 I paid for it.Saw the same TV in Sams Club for 120.00 more. Nice picture and easy operationwith remote. The sound is the only thing that I find that is not as good as Ihad expected, but I will be purchasing a surround sound system this year and thatwill solve that problem. Over all great buy!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV!  Too long for shipping.
Reviews.Author: Mlmpep
Reviews.Content: The TV is set up and works great!  It is a beautiful TV and we hooked up surround sound to it.  The shipper that Amazon chose for delivery had a lot to be desired.  It took 1 week longer than the estimated time shown when I purchased the item.  I think it was Pilot Delivery that delivered the package.  They treated the package well, but was really late.  Had to schedule an appointment for delivery and because there were no appointments on the designated day, it was pushed to the next day.  I will take this into account next time I purchase a big item from Amazon...

Reviews.Title: black screen of death in only 4 months
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The title says it all, I am surprised Vizio had been getting good ratings and it was a best selling tv.  I have never seen a tv die so fast.  I still have a cheap White Westinghouse 32 in lcd for 4 years and still goin strong.

Reviews.Title: look elsewhere
Reviews.Author: terry b
Reviews.Content: i love amazon but i just bought this tv with a 3yr warrenty for 498.00 at walmart buy the tv its great just not here.

Reviews.Title: Stay Away -- Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Ricky Jones "Eustace Scrubb"
Reviews.Content: Whatever you buy, stay away from vizio. The product is cheap, only lasted 12 months and 2 weeks, and they refuse to help in any way. Terrible product, stay away from vizio.

Reviews.Title: Better price elsewhere
Reviews.Author: Varden
Reviews.Content: I haven't even unpacked the TV yet. Sam's has them on sale for $488. Walmart is selling them for $568. The in store display on this TV ranked as good as any others priced much higher. I'm hoping the get the same quality here at home.

Reviews.Title: Peace of trash!
Reviews.Author: van_d_man
Reviews.Content: I got this television, knowing that older Vizio models from Costco worked well for 3-4years.Guess what! I plugged the TV and scanned for channels...... A nice picture appeared....Then after 5 min a loud "POP" sound took place and the audio disappeared!Checked whether I have muted it accidentally - no!Plaid with the volume up and down - no sound at al!~Turn off and on the TV again - sound worked.5 min later - "Pop" - and no sound!Gave it another chance... unplugged, re-plugged the TV - same thing - the audio disappears after about 3-5 min.Do not buy this particular model Vizio! It has a major issue with the motherboard. Vizio do not want to admit it - the QA technicians probably just plug it for a 1 minute - if shows picture and sound - then they pack it and send it to the stores as working model!I am sending it back on Monday!What a waste of money! Spend the extra 150 bucks, buy a dissent LG even 120HZ
